objective.title: Given a scenario, use the appropriate Microsoft command-line tools.

stem: A user reports that a newly installed device is not working correctly and shows a warning icon in Windows. Which tool should you use to manage the device and driver?
explanation: Device Manager is the primary Windows utility for viewing hardware devices, checking status codes, and managing drivers (update, rollback, disable/enable).

rationales.0: Incorrect. Event Viewer is primarily used to review application/system/security logs.
rationales.1: Incorrect. Services.msc is primarily used to start/stop/configure Windows services.
rationales.2: Incorrect. Task Manager is primarily used to view processes/services and resource usage.
rationales.3: Incorrect. Disk Management is primarily used to create/format/extend volumes, assign drive letters.
rationales.4: Incorrect. gpedit.msc is primarily used to edit local group policy (Pro/Enterprise).
rationales.5: Correct. Device Manager is used to view device status, update/rollback drivers, and manage devices.
rationales.6: Incorrect. Performance Monitor is primarily used to track counters over time.
rationales.7: Incorrect. msconfig is primarily used to manage startup and boot options (legacy).

objective.title: Summarize various security measures and their purposes.
bullets: - Bollards գ Retina scanner գ Short Message Service (SMS)
- Access control vestibule գ Fingerprint scanner գ Voice call
- Badge reader գ Palm print scanner գ Time-based one-time
- Video surveillance գ Facial recognition password (TOTP)
- Alarm systems technology (FRT) գ One-time password/
- Motion sensors գ Voice recognition technology passcode (OTP)

stem: PBQ: You are securing a SOHO wireless router. Select ALL actions that improve security (choose 4).
options: Change default admin username and password

objective.title: Given a scenario, apply common methods for securing mobile devices.

stem: A user reports repeated browser redirects and unknown toolbars. Which is the BEST next step after isolating the system from the network?
options: Run an anti-malware scan in Safe Mode
Delete the user profile and continue using the system
Immediately restore from last week's backup without scanning
explanation: After isolation/quarantine, you typically identify and remove the malware using approved tools. Running an anti-malware scan (often in Safe Mode) is a common and effective next step before recovery actions.

rationales.0: Correct. Safe Mode limits third-party startup items and can improve scan effectiveness.

stem: You need to transport a damaged laptop that may contain a swollen lithium-ion battery. What is the BEST action?
options: Freeze the battery to reduce swelling before shipping
Tape the battery contacts and ship in a padded envelope
Follow your organization's hazardous material (hazmat) procedure and do not ship via standard mail
Fully discharge the battery and place it in a pocket
explanation: Swollen lithium-ion batteries can rupture or catch fire. Follow documented safety/hazmat procedures and use approved handling, packaging, and disposal methods.

options: Follow your organization's hazardous material (hazmat) procedure and do not ship via standard mail
Tape the battery contacts and ship in a padded envelope
Freeze the battery to reduce swelling before shipping
Fully discharge the battery and place it in a pocket
explanation: Swollen lithium-ion batteries can rupture or catch fire. Follow documented safety/hazmat procedures and use approved handling, packaging, and disposal methods.

rationales.0: Correct. Swollen lithium-ion batteries are a safety hazard and require approved handling/disposal.
rationales.1: Incorrect. This action is unsafe or noncompliant with standard safety procedures.
rationales.2: Incorrect. This action is unsafe or noncompliant with standard safety procedures.
rationales.3: Incorrect. This action is unsafe or noncompliant with standard safety procedures.
